name: Xi'an
title: Xi'an - Traveling China like your home yard
overview: Xi'an stands as one of the most historically significant cities in all of China, having served as the capital for thirteen dynasties spanning over 3,100 years. This ancient metropolis, formerly known as Chang'an, was the eastern terminus of the legendary Silk Road, serving as the gateway between East and West where merchants, missionaries, and adventurers from across the known world converged to trade goods, ideas, and cultures. The city's profound historical importance is etched into every stone of its magnificent city wall, every terracotta soldier standing guard over Emperor Qin Shi Huang's tomb, and every brick of the towering Giant Wild Goose Pagoda. Walking through Xi'an today is like traversing through the pages of a living history book. The Ancient City Wall, the most complete and best-preserved city wall in China, encircles the old town with its 14-kilometer circumference, offering visitors a unique vantage point to observe the harmonious coexistence of ancient and modern China. As you cycle or stroll along the ramparts, you'll witness the contrast between traditional courtyard houses and modern skyscrapers, between elderly residents practicing tai chi in the morning mist and young professionals hurrying to work in the bustling commercial districts. Beyond its archaeological treasures, Xi'an is a vibrant culinary destination that tantalizes the taste buds with flavors developed over millennia. The famous Muslim Quarter comes alive at night with the sizzle of lamb skewers on open grills, the aroma of roujiamo (Chinese hamburger) wafting through narrow alleyways, and the hearty warmth of yangrou paomo (mutton soup with flatbread) served in bustling restaurants. The city's diverse heritage is reflected in its cuisine, blending Han Chinese traditions with Islamic influences brought by Silk Road traders. Whether you're exploring the archaeological wonders that made Xi'an famous worldwide or simply soaking in the atmosphere of this ancient yet dynamic city, Xi'an offers an unforgettable journey through the heart of Chinese civilization.

gettingThere: By Air: Xi'an Xianyang International Airport (XIY) with domestic and international flights.
By Train: Major high-speed rail hub connecting to Beijing, Shanghai, and other cities.
By Bus: Long-distance bus services from nearby provinces and cities.
gettingAround: Metro: Xi'an Metro provides efficient transportation to major attractions.
Bus: Comprehensive public bus network covering all districts.
Taxi/Didi: Readily available for convenient travel.
Bike-sharing: Convenient for exploring the ancient city walls and historic areas.

activities: Morning: Visit the world-famous Terracotta Army archaeological site.
Afternoon: Explore the Ancient City Wall, one of the best-preserved in China.
Evening: Stroll through the Muslim Quarter for dinner and shopping.
Morning: Visit the Big Wild Goose Pagoda and its surrounding temple complex.
Afternoon: Explore the Shaanxi History Museum for ancient artifacts.
Evening: Enjoy traditional Tang Dynasty music and dance show.
